bibl.title: Military Record for John J. Moran, August 21, 1919

div1.p: Harold Sorenson and R.P. Harbold describe Moran's service in the army.

div1.head: Military Record for John J. Moran, August 21, 1919
div1.p:
An efficient officer. His work has been thorough, accurate
and always of the very best, especially adapted to Finance.

During the time I have known Capt. Moran I have always found him
a man of the highest type, and an officer, such as it is a pleasure
to know.

div1.head: Letter from R. P. HARBOLD, August 27, 1919
div1.p:
Captain J. J. Moran, Q.M.C. has been on duty as Disbursing officer
at the Central Records Office. He has been under my personal
observation for 3-1/2 months. He is an efficient, loyal, energetic
officer. Possesses the highest qualifications of an officer, and
gentleman, and is well fitted to perform any duty that may be
given him.
div1.closer:
(SGD) R. P. HARBOLD,
Lt. Col., I.G.D. TRUE EXTRACT FROM
“OFFICER'S RECORD BOOK”.
